item.title: Basic Framework - Physics For Game Dev #1
item.description:
In this video we setup an initial physics framework and use the laws of motion to update the position of our particle.
üî• See the list of the books that I'm using as background information for my tutorials: https://ogldev.org/books.html. I highly recommend them for learning more about OpenGL and Vulkan. These are affiliate links so if you use them to buy any of the books the price is the same for you and I will get a small commission (thank-you!).
üìö Timecodes üìö 0:00 Intro 0:25 Dev Env 0:49 VS Project setup 1:53 Visualization 2:59 Application class 3:57 Physics System class 4:39 Design issues 5:33 Update Listener 6:27 PointMass class 8:38 Physics Update 10:26 Demo 11:02 Outro
Please visit https://ogldev.org to see more of my tutorials on modern OpenGL.
üî•Link to source: https://github.com/emeiri/ogldev/blob/master/PhysicsForGameDev/Tutorial01_ParticleDynamics/tutorial01.cpp If you want to get the same version of the code that was used in the video checkout the tag 'PHYSICS_01'
Feel free to comment below.
üîóContacts: üîπEmail: ogldev1@gmail.com üîπInstagram: @ogldev1 üîπGithub: https://github.com/emeiri/ogldev.git üîπTikTok - https://www.tiktok.com/@ogldev üîπTwitter: @ogldev üîπDiscord: https://discord.gg/CZdVwZgTYk üîπOne time donations (Paypal): https://ogldev.org/donate.html üîπPatreon: https://www.patreon.com/ogldev
üôèCredits: üîπImages by AcatXIo, nugroho dwi hartawan from https://Pixabay.com üîπBlackboard image from https://Pixabay.com üîπMusic: "No Indication" by TrackTribe - Youtube Audio Library
Enjoy,
Etay Meiri
#opengl #physics #physicsengine

item.title: Why Do We Still Pay For International Calls in 2025? |
item.description: We live in an era where global communication is instant, continuous, and, thanks to apps like WhatsApp, Zoom and Messenger, usually completely free. Yes, technically the data is drawn down from your cellular data allowance, but free wi-fi is prevalent everywhere you work, shop or drink. Yet, if you, a typical New Zealand mobile user like me, pick up your phone and dial a family member in the UK, you will be hit with a retail charge that can be 50 to 100 times higher than the technical cost of routing that voice data, US$0.51/minute in my specific case. (I will use US$ as I have an international audience and everyone knows how to convert those)

item.title: Firefox for Web Developers (@firefoxwebdevs@mastodon.social)
item.description:
Something that hasn't been made clear: Firefox will have an option to completely disable all AI features.
We've been calling it the AI kill switch internally. I'm sure it'll ship with a less murderous name, but that's how seriously and absolutely we're taking this.
